title: I05-5004

sentences.text: Towards deep analysis of compositional classes of paraphrases , we have examined a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples , in which sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement .
Our preliminary experiments on building a paraphrase corpus have so far been producing promising results , which we have evaluated according to cost-efficiency , exhaustiveness , and reliability .

aliases: sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement
Entity-sentential_paraphrase_are_collect.description: A methodology used to collect paraphrased sentences for distinct classes, involving automated candidate generation and human evaluation.

mentions.local_name: sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement

Entity-class-oriented_framework.label: class-oriented framework
Entity-class-oriented_framework.description: A methodology or approach used to collect paraphrase examples by collecting sentential paraphrases for each paraphrase class separately through automatic candidate generation and manual judgment.

Entity-a_class-oriented_framework_for_co.label: a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples
aliases: a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples
Entity-a_class-oriented_framework_for_co.description: A system that collects paraphrase examples organized by classes, using a combination of automated candidate generation and human evaluation.

Entity-compositional_class_of_paraphrase.description: A set of categories or classes that group together paraphrased sentences with similar meanings, allowing for a deeper analysis of compositional relationships between them.

Entity-sentential_paraphrase.description: A set of phrases or sentences that convey similar meanings to an original sentence, often used in language processing tasks.

Entity-paraphrase_corpus.description: A collection of texts or phrases with similar meanings

Entity-reliability.label: reliability
Entity-reliability.description: A measure of the consistency or dependability with which a system, process, or outcome performs as expected.

Entity-cost-efficiency.label: cost-efficiency
Entity-cost-efficiency.description: A measure of how well a system or process achieves its goals while minimizing waste and maximizing resources.

summary: Towards deep analysis of compositional classes of paraphrases , we have examined a class-oriented framework for collecting paraphrase examples , in which sentential paraphrases are collected for each paraphrase class separately by means of automatic candidate generation and manual judgement . Our preliminary experiments on building a paraphrase corpus have so far been producing promising results , which we have evaluated according to cost-efficiency , exhaustiveness , and reliability .

Predicate-are_collected.label: are collected
Predicate-are_collected.description: To gather or accumulate a set of items into a single entity or collection.

Predicate-have_examined.label: have examined
Predicate-have_examined.description: To investigate or study something thoroughly and systematically, typically to gain insight, understand its properties, or identify patterns. The subject has engaged in a deliberate and methodical process of investigation, analysis, or scrutiny to gather information about the object.

Predicate-have_been_producing.label: have been producing
Predicate-have_been_producing.description: Indicates that an ongoing or continuous process has yielded a specific outcome or result. The predicate connects the subject (the entity performing the action) to the object (the outcome or result), suggesting a causal relationship between them.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' indicates a state of being or existence between the subject and object. It suggests that there is a connection or relationship between them, implying equivalence, similarity, or identity.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject concept is more specific than or subsumed by the object concept. The predicate connects two concepts with a hierarchical relationship, where the subject represents a narrower term and the object represents a broader term.
